questions.question: What does “exposure” mean in photography?
options: The overall amount of light recorded (image brightness)
questions.reviewHint: Exposure = overall brightness captured by the sensor.

questions.question: A photo that looks too dark is described as…
Which three settings make up the “exposure triangle”?
questions.reviewHint: Only these three directly control exposure.

questions.question: Which exposure mode lets you choose the aperture while the camera sets the shutter speed?
questions.reviewHint: A/Av = you set aperture for depth of field.

questions.question: Which exposure mode lets you choose the shutter speed while the camera sets the aperture?
questions.reviewHint: S/Tv = you set shutter speed to control motion.

questions.question: When you raise ISO to keep the same brightness in low light, which side effect usually increases?
What does +1 EV exposure compensation do to your photo in Av/Tv?
If the histogram is bunched to the left, what does that suggest?
If the histogram is clipped against the right edge, what’s likely happening?
What is depth of field?
options: The range of distances that appears acceptably sharp in the photo
The amount of background blur caused by zooming
The distance your lens can focus at infinity
questions.reviewHint: Depth of field = zone of acceptable sharpness.
